content.description: The size of a bird population is modeled by the function <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> that is a solution to the logistic differential equation <math alttext="the derivative of P, with respect to t, equals, the fraction P over 3, end fraction, minus the fraction P squared over 2100" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>2100</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is measured in years for <math alttext="t greater than or equal to 0 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>≥</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and the initial population satisfies <math alttext="P of 0, is greater than 0 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following statements could be true?
content.question: <math alttext="the limit as t approaches infinity, of, P of t, is greater than 1150" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>→</mo><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munder><mi>P</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>></mo><mn>1150</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>The graph of <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> has a point of inflection for <math alttext="t greater than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.The maximum rate of change of <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> occurs at <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

topic.text: 7.9: (BC ONLY) Logistic Models with Differential Equations

skill.text: Skill 3.F: Explain the meaning of mathematical solutions in context.
